Posts.Content: Feb 19, 2008 12:47AM gonsalvesa wrote: I had a lumpectomy two years ago, chemotherapy and radiation.  About 4 months ago, I noticed a red bump on the same breast near my incision site.  I thought I'd gotten a "bite" from an insect when I walk my dogs.  Over time, I got a couple more red "bites, then I started getting redness along the incision site and around it.  Then on the opposite side, I got a small rash - nothing big, just weird.  I decided to show it to my oncologist.  It was metatastic breast cancer.  Please go and have your "rash" checked out with biopsy.  Because there's no lump, it doesn't show on mammogram or even CT scan and is often misdiagnosed.  I don't want to alarm you, but sometimes we need to be a little alarmed - it can save our life.
Posts.Title: weird rash along incision site sandilee NST40
